subject: Add Actions API for Google's RootOfTrust resource.
commitMessage:
Add Actions API for Google's RootOfTrust resource.

This commit introduces an Actions API on the Google's RootOfTrust
resource

In this change, I introduce Actions on Google's RootOfTrust device. The
API takes a stream of bytes in a POST request, and forwards that on dbus
to the appropriate service. The dbus service 'hothd' is responsible to
handle sanitize the input.

Tested: Manually using curl.

Change-Id: Ie9af534fe1df66569b4e75023583b2851450cbe1
Signed-off-by: Feras Aldahlawi <faldahlawi@gmail.com>

(1 comment)
Some of my comments are based on the assumption, this API is trying to be as Redfish like as possible. If that is not true, some of these can be ignored.

You don't want some required privileges?
E.g. 
        .privileges({"Login"})

Maybe something more like 
        .privileges({"ConfigureComponents", "ConfigureManager"})
for the action ?
Not sure if "ConfigureComponents" or "ConfigureManager" are required. Client must be root on machine though, so probably "Login" is sufficient.

If you are following Redfish here, the actions are typically.. 
<schema>.<action name>

E.g.
Manager.ResetToDefaults
Done
If you are following Redfish I always see the parameters capitalized
Done

I have not seen a "readJson" before. 
I have seen Description here: https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/565c0911faea72128a3a8c4b8b5ec3094756d82e/include/ibm/management_console_rest.hpp#L125

But is this even needed?
I guess I can live without it.

Do you need this? 
We just typically don't do this in bmcweb..
Can it at least be something generic so it could be shared?
I see... I guess logging is enough.

Why do you need this? 
It is an action, if it is successful just return 200 / 204?

if you do need to return a response, you could define it like Redfish does 

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/9a128eb3fc3008f802974360e98de6495ed1a66b/static/redfish/v1/JsonSchemas/CertificateService/CertificateService.json#L115
Some SendCommands will return measurements. So we need a return value for some cases.

This is not what I would expect, I would expect 

<Action Name="SendCommand" >

like

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/static/redfish/v1/schema/Bios_v1.xml#L71

And then the Parameter Name is RequestBytes. 

Note: Redfish would probably use a more descriptive name than just RequestBytes for the Parameter Name.

Fixed. I misunderstood how that works.

In regards to naming, I don't like "RequestBytes" I couldn't think of something more specific. SendCommand is supposed to take commands in bytes format and forward it to a RoT device. Commands could range from commands that get some measurements, to commands that alter the state of RoT.

Aren't you calling the parameter something else? I see "requestBytes", reqBytes)) in the google_service_root.hpp

Could add a description, required parameter, etc. 
E.g. 
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/10f270b41dee295f90dccac091883b94b82dd0d9/static/redfish/v1/JsonSchemas/Bios/Bios.json#L172

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/static/redfish/v1/schema/Bios_v1.xml#L75
Wonderful. Thanks.
Ping

Could we get the D-Bus interface upstream ?
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/search?q=SendHostCommand
I would think you would want a link to the RootOfTrust from here..
Done
GoogleRootOfTrust? Follow the other types? e.g. GoogleChassis
I think we ought to change GoogleRootOfTrust and others since it is a stutter with 'google/v1'. Will keep it RootOfTrust here.

Redfish would probably come up with a better parameter name here, something describing what the actual data is.
E.g. RootOfTrustCommand, Command, (don't have anything good but hopefully you get my point).  You can ignore.
Great advice. Command sounds straightforward. From the definition, we can know it accepts bytes.

There is a ActionParameterMissing https://redfish.dmtf.org/registries/Base.1.12.0.json 

"Indicates that the action requested was missing a parameter that is required to process the action."

Don't you want a check for if RequestBytes is missing / empty and throw something similar to that back?
Done

Any checking to make sure the format is good, etc? 
I don't see SendHostCommand out in https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/search?q=SendHostCommand
does it throw back like a bad request or anything?
This is still internal at Google. But in the process of upstreaming. Errors are reported in ResponseBytes.

Do you want a requiredParameter here? 
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/b7ff344535c42af074c60bfb272ef66a2ba157b4/static/redfish/v1/JsonSchemas/Memory/Memory.json#L92
Does "Nullable='false'" make it required?
I didn't think so. I thought "requiredParameter": true, did

You could add a bit more here about the format. E.g. 
"The string should be space delimited, hexadecimal ..."
Done
friendly ping.

This seems reasonable to me. 
I think the D-Bus interface should be upstream if this is so I think getting that upstream first is a requirement IMO.

okay.
We will make an effort to upstream the hoth interface to upstream to phosphor-dbus-interfaces.
go/obmcl/50919 has been created to upstream the hoth interface.

Full URL is:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/50919/
change is in!
Thank you.
nitpick: we follow https://cbea.ms/git-commit/ which says "4. Do not end the subject line with a period"
Seems reasonable have some comments on the schemas, etc.
Should you implement these in the GoogleServiceRoot schema?
Google Chassis? to not get confused with Redfish Chassis? Same for Name. Fits better with what is there today too.
I think GoogleRootOfTrust like you have GoogleChassis, GoogleServiceRoot fits better with what is there today
Maybe Google RootOfTrust to match the Service Root?
I would expect this to be something more than just Login but your interface so I will leave it up to you
I don't see this property.. I do see properties like "RootOfTrust"
I don't see this Property implemented
Isn't this suppose to be com.google.gbmc.Hoth ?

yes.
This is the down stream path, it will need to be update moving forward.
Please Abandon this CL.
